newsitem.title: UK: UK may review Halliburton purchase of OGC.
newsitem.headline: UK may review Halliburton purchase of OGC.

text.p: Britain's Office of Fair Trading said on Tuesday it was inviting comment from parties interested in the competition issues raised by a proposed UK acquisition by US engineering services giant Halliburton Company.

In a statement worded under the standard terms of what it calls an "invitiation to comment' notice, the OFT said it was prepared to consider a full investigation on competition grounds should it find the transaction to qualify.
Two weeks ago Halliburton said it had agreed takeover terms to buy Scottish oilfield services company OGC International Plc that values OGC at about 72.6 million stg.

The deal is seen giving Halliburton full control of Brown & Root AOC, ccurrenly a joint venture between two of the groups' main operating companies in the integrated offshore oil and gas service sector.
